item.title: Wat do i add to environmental variables?
item.dc:creator: @99hpw0w 99hpw0w
item.description:
@99hpw0w wrote:

IT’S ALL UNDER STORMCUTTER’S TUTORIAL ON HOW TO MAKE A SERVE IN WHICH IF YOU FOLLOW WOULD BE THE EASIEST THING TO DO IN THE WORLD!!! BUT IF YOU DONT KNOW HOW TO GET THERE THIS IS WHAT YOU NEED TO DO… BUT I HIGHLY RECOMMEND GOING AND TAKING A LOOK AT STORMCUTTER’S TUTORIAL…

If you know how to get to enviromental variables find where it says variables for owners… most likely you probly already have classpath but if that chance you dont just add it in and edit it and put this in:
CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Then find the variable path and do the same edit it and put this in: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;

IF YOU DONT HAVE JDK 6U6 JUST MAKE SURE YOU ADD WHATEVER JDK YOUR USING

Then your done… been a whole lot easier if you would of followed stormcutter’s tutorial cant stress that enough…

AND BTW… YOUR WELCOME…

Read full topic
